content: In what type of dwelling did Bilbo Baggins live in J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Hobbit"?

Bilbo Baggins lived in a hobbit-hole, which was a comfortable and cozy dwelling typical of hobbits in J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Hobbit." These homes were usually dug into hillsides or slopes and featured round doors and windows, as well as comfortable interiors with multiple rooms and a warm atmosphere. Bilbo's hobbit-hole was located in the Shire, specifically in the village of Hobbiton.
